Repeated Omicron exposures override ancestral SARS-CoV-2 immune imprinting - Nature.com
articles.description: Exposure to early variants of SARS-CoV-2 results in immune imprinting in mouse models and in humans, reducing neutralizing antibody titres against Omicron variants, which could be mitigated with multiple updated boosters.

articles.title: HIV-1 Env trimers asymmetrically engage CD4 receptors in membranes - Nature.com
articles.description: HIV-1 Env trimers bound to one, two and three CD4 molecules are observed at membrane–membrane interfaces between HIV-1 and CD4-decorated virus-like particles.
